key_points: Facebook employees reported inability to access buildings due to badge system failure.
Conference rooms and other internal systems within Facebook were inaccessible.
Employees resort to using text messaging and Outlook email for internal communication.
Facebook, Messenger, Instagram, and WhatsApp experienced worldwide outages.
The outages were reported by users on DownDetector, affecting multiple Facebook apps.
Facebook acknowledged the outages, promising to resolve issues quickly.
The outages began around 11:45 a.m. ET on Monday, without resolution at the time of publishing.
CEO Mark Zuckerberg's net worth dropped by nearly $7 billion in 5 hours amidst the outages.
Facebook's stock fell by about 5% during the outage period.
Outages coincided with the release of an explosive whistleblower report.
